title: Facebook Grows Even In Tough Times
text: Facebook's online advertising business continues to grow despite headwinds.

title: Pinterest tops social media stocks this year, but another name could be best long-term bet
text: Pinterest leads the social media stocks in 2020. Ari Wald of Oppenheimer and Boris Schlossberg of BK Asset Management dig into the group for any other winners.

title: It turns out Zuckerberg was right that ad boycotts won't hurt Facebook that much financially
text: Major corporations including Coca-Cola, J.M. Smucker Company, Diageo, Mars, HP and CVS Health will continue pausing on Facebook after the official end of a major advertiser boycott of the platform, but others are returning.

title: Facebook Is Superior - I Realized This And Bought My First Shares
text: Facebook published the figures for the second quarter almost simultaneously with Alphabet.

title: 4 Possible Reasons Why The FANG Stocks Are Near All Time Highs
text: It’s been the summer of FANG. The FANG stocks (Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB), Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN), Netflix Inc (NASDAQ: NFLX), and Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) all made dramatic turnarounds in April and May, and all four made new all-time highs in July.

title: Facebook doubles down on work-from-office with massive NYC lease near Penn Station
text: We’ve had huge debates about the future of work — are we going to be working from home, working from the office, or perhaps, working from anywhere? Work From Home is dead, long live Work From Anywhere Well, Facebook has put its wager down, and it’s work from office.

title: Messenger launches a new chat plugin for business websites to reach non-Facebook customers
text: Facebook is making it easier for businesses to leverage its Messenger service on their own websites. The company in November 2017 first launched a new customer chat plugin which allowed customers to talk directly with a business on the business’s own website using the Messenger service.

title: WhatsApp launches factcheck feature aimed at viral messages
text: Users will be able to check the truthfulness of messages that have come through five or more people by clicking on a magnifying glass icon

title: Strategist: Don't fight tech, own it
text: David Bianco, chief investment officer for the Americas at DWS Group, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss the challenges the market poses for investors.

title: The Facebook ad boycott didn’t cripple Facebook. But it sent a message
text:
The Chief Marketing Officer of password manager Dashlane explains why her company joined in the widespread boycott—and how it’s just the first step toward holding Facebook accountable. 
When my company, Dashlane, joined a handful of brands in pulling advertising from Facebook for the month of July, we couldn’t have imagined that hundreds of other companies would join us to #StopHateForProfit.

title: Politics Of The Big Tech Hearing: Facebook, Apple, Amazon And Google
text: Through a long series of unforced errors borne of arrogance, our large big tech companies—marvels of creativity and innovation—have needlessly put themselves in serious political jeopardy.

title: WhatsApp pilots new feature to fight misinformation: Search the web
text: WhatsApp, one of the most popular instant messaging platforms on the planet, has rolled out a new feature in select markets that makes it easier for users to verify whether the assertions made in messages they have received on the app are true. The Facebook -owned service has enabled users in Brazil, Italy, Ireland, Mexico, […]

title: Vornado Shares Jump 5.7% As Facebook Leases Space At New York Farley Building
text: Vornado Realty Trust (NYSE: VNO) shares jumped in the after-hours session Monday as the company announced Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) has leased all the office space at the Farley Building in New York.
